title: Shiying Xiao
text: We propose a novel betweenness centrality measure that incorporates available node-specific auxiliary information for weighted, directed networks. The implementation is publicly available in an R package ionet.

title: Shiying Xiao
text:
Previous
Next

I started raising a Sphynx cat named Kiwi in March 2024.
Born on August 25, 2023 in Toronto, he has brought immense joy into my life.
Kiwi is a little embodiment of affection, writing ‘pet me’ haikus with his
grape-like eyes and rolling around like a sugar-dusted mochi ball.
Witnessing his growth has been incredibly rewarding.

title: Shiying Xiao
text:
Published in Physica A: Statistical Mechanics and its Applications, 2022.
We propose a novel betweenness centrality measure that incorporates available node-specific auxiliary information for weighted, directed networks. The implementation is publicly available in an R package ionet.
Recommended citation: Xiao, S., Yan, J. and Zhang, P. “Incoporating auxiliary information in betweenness measure for input-output networks”. Physica A: Statistical Mechanics and its Applications, 607, 128200. 10.1016/j.physa.2022.128200.


@article{xiao2022incorporating,
  title = {Incoporating Auxiliary Information in Betweenness Measure for Input-Output Networks},
  author = {Xiao, Shiying and Yan, Jun and Zhang, Panpan},
  journal = {Physica A: Statistical Mechanics and its Applications},
  volume = 607,
  pages = 128200,
  year = 2022,
  publisher = {Elsevier},
  doi = {10.1016/j.physa.2022.128200}
}

title: Shiying Xiao
section: Regional and sectoral structures of the Chinese economy: A network perspective from multi-regional input-output tables
text:
Regional and sectoral structures of the Chinese economy: A network perspective from multi-regional input-output tables




Published in Physica A: Statistical Mechanics and its Applications, 2021.
We analyze the regional and sectoral structure of the Chinese economy with the province-sector MRIOTs of China in 2007 and 2012 using network analysis tools. The implementation is publicly available on GitHub.
Recommended citation: Wang, T., Xiao, S., Yan, J. and Zhang, P. “Regional and sectoral structures of the Chinese economy: A network perspective from multi-regional input-output tables”. Physica A: Statistical Mechanics and its Applications, 581, 126196. 10.1016/j.physa.2021.126196.


@article{wang2021regional,
  title = {Regional and Sectoral Structures of the {C}hinese Economy: {A} Network Perspective from Multi-Regional Input-Output Tables},
  author = {Wang, Tao and Xiao, Shiying and Yan, Jun and Zhang, Panpan},
  journal = {Physica A: Statistical Mechanics and its Applications},
  volume = 581,
  pages = 126196,
  year = 2021,
  publisher = {Elsevier},
  doi = {10.1016/j.physa.2021.126196}
}

title: Shiying Xiao
text: Hiya! I am Shiying Xiao, a graduate student in the Department of Statistics at the University of Connecticut (UConn). I also serve as a consultant with UConn Statistical Consulting Services, where I provide analytical and methodological support to researchers across the university.
